definition: to revere as sole orthodoxy/to hold supremacy (of a religion, ideology, cultural norm, social group etc)/to be dominant
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
Dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucian (idiom)/sole dominant ideology
pinyin: ba4 chu4 bai3 jia1 , du2 zun1 ru2 shu4

sentences.english: But from the start he plainly had an elevated sense of his own importance.
sentences.chinese: 但從一開始，他顯然就有一種唯我獨尊的心理。

sentences.english: TangTai-zong admired Wang's calligraphy very much which consolidated the Wang's respectable position in the calligraphy field.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗推崇王羲之書法，從而奠定了王書的獨尊地位。

sentences.english: So, it was hard to regard the political opening of Emperor Hanwu as a product of "the Confucianism Worship Alone".
sentences.chinese: 充其量可以說，“獨尊儒術”開武帝政治開放之一途。

sentences.english: Leaders in Russia and Brazil also expressed concerns about the dollar's primacy.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯和巴西的領導人也對美元獨尊表達了擔憂。

sentences.english: People are illogical, unreasonable and self-centered.
sentences.chinese: 人們往往會邏輯混亂，不可理喻，惟我獨尊。

sentences.english: I believe in the power of love and sharing, and despise hatred and monopoly.
sentences.chinese: 我相信愛和分享的力量，藐視仇恨與唯我獨尊。

definition: to pass on doctrines from master to disciple (Buddhism)
"universal love", principle advocated by Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3], stressing that people should care for everyone equally
Classic of Rites (same as 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
